newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - September 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - September 25.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Opposition United National Party will continue to take part in parliamentary select committee debating peace plan to end ethnic war but boycott official government functions because of violence against their supporters.
Ruling People's Alliance general secretary D.M. Jayaratne proposes forming supreme national council devoid of party politics to solve national problems.

Justice Minister G.L. Peiris says regional autonomy under government peace plan to end ethnic war will provide powerful impetus to allocation of more financial resources for economic development of remote regions of island which had hitherto been neglected.
Foreign Minister Lakshman Kadirgamar says Sri Lanka welcomes initiative of international community to fight terrorism and that the island is the longest-suffering victim of terrorism and brutality.
Opposition United National Party decides to boycott official government functions because of violence against their supporters.
Air force destroys Tamil Tiger rebel mortar positions killing large number of guerrillas in Kilinochchi battle.
Navy and air force destroy 10 Tamil Tiger rebel boats at Vettilaikerni bringing reinforcements to fight government troops on the offensive at Kilinochchi.
Security tightened in Colombo after reports that Tamil Tiger rebels could attack the city in retaliation for army offensive in north.
